page.title: 02Lyminge village hall
page.content: Construction of the village hall started at the beginning of 1981. It took about a year to build and was opened on 15th May 1982 by Lady Brabourne, daughter of Lord Mountbatten. Lyminge Cubs and Scouts, and also the Brownies and Guides came to the opening along with a large number of villagers. Three years after the opening we are still paying for the hall, but now it is nearly paid for. Walks and fetes raised the money. The hall is used for roller skating, playgroup, dramatic society, judo and meetings. The football field is used by the Cubs and Scouts, also by the school for fetes. The village hall consists of the main hall, a club room, a meeting room, a kitchen, bar, showers, toilets and store room. The approximate cost of hiring the hall is Â£5 per hour.
